channel.title: Korean Conflict
channel.description:
Hey guys, I think you all have got these information already (ain't you?) Since April that south korean navy ship was sank in north korea's area, there have been some news form Korean Peninsula. Canon's damage, wikileaks' information about nuclear sites in Burma, US-Jap-KR manoeuvre, fishing ship sinking this monday, these could make something I call 'WARS.' :frowning:
Do you think these event would cause new world wars? show your opinion.

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: Frozen_Cham
item.description:
technocrat said the same way about things happened when the war was begun.

First, two countries who have no good relation would start some crimes to eachother.
Then they were gonna look for their allies.
If one of those two sides, or in the worst case, both side, has their own nuke, they were planning to launch a nuke to a little country belong to the other side, so the war’s begin.
Bunch of 'lil nukes were launch repeatedly so that the sky turn to the red one.
Nuclear dust were now cover the rest of the world. That is fucking worse than the globe warming; things were cooled down because a lack of sunlight for a century.

Read full topic

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: ThatOneGuy
item.description:
I was under the impression that given the right padding or shielding, an electronic device could withstand an EMP. If this is true I would think that it would be extremely stupid for the Government not to have at least some internal network or whatever protected. I don’t know much about how the internet works on a fundamental level so if any of this doesn’t make sense or just sounds dumb, forgive me :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Perhaps, but they’ll still be something. The government probably has protected nodes.

Read full topic

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Yeah, but when a couple of nuclear bombs go off, I don’t think there’ll be much left for anything to be worked around.

Read full topic

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Burbinator:

I don’t see how they could make it withstand EMP.

The Internet is a concept, a plan of a network. DARPA-style.

Pretty much all of the hardware isn’t meant to be resilient to nuclear blasts, they’re expected to be knocked out… the purpose is to allow dead nodes to be worked around.

Read full topic

Fancy Pants:

guys guys you’re not even realizing tho
if theres a nuclear war
what will happen to the internet

i might have to watch real ppl fucking
or call ppl faggots to their faces
or like
buy cds

As far as I know, the internet network, at least in the USA, was designed to withstand a nuclear attack as its original purpose was to keep people connected in case of the Russians sending their nukes.

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: Frozen_Cham
item.description:
Someonerandm:

I fear that this will have broader implications. The North Koreans will probably attack the South and we probably will get involved, but I fear the results of our spec-ops missions. Many of the islands in that region contain unusual plants, animal, and trees, and bombing them could easily upset the ecosystem, unleashing a mass of strange [COLOR=‘DeepSkyBlue’]blue aliens who then go and invade New York for some reason.

nice theory :freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Korean Conflict
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Professor Terguson: You remember that thing we had about 30 years ago called the Korean conflict? And how we failed to achieve victory? How come we didn’t cross the 38th parallel and push those rice-eaters back to the Great Wall of China? Then take the fucking wall apart brick by brick and nuke them back into the fucking stone age forever? Tell me why! How come? Say it! Say it!

Thornton Melon: All right. I’ll say it. 'Cause Truman was too much of a pussy wimp to let MacArthur go in there and blow out those Commie bastards!

Professor Terguson: Good answer. Good answer. I like the way you think. I’m gonna be watching you.

(Wait, what are we talking about again?)

Read full topic
